sentences: Sheila Dhar (1929 â€“ 26 July 2001) was an Indian author and singer of Kirana gharana.
After dropping out of Lady Hardinge Medical College, Sheila joined Hindu College and was the topper of Delhi University English Honours batch in 1950.

Sheila had published a book - Raga'n Josh - about the lifestyle of the Mathur Kayasthas in the Delhi of the 1940s and '50s providing a glimpse of the old Delhi, which included her experiences with life in bureaucracy and anecdotes from the lives of musicians like Bade Ghulam Ali Khan, Kesarbai Kerkar, Pran Nath, and Begum Akhtar.
